item.title: Water leaking from water mains cover, 11th August
item.description:
Located on the edge of the cycle / footpath and grass verge a water main has been leaking for a number of weeks. Path is becoming slippery under the cycle wheels.

item.title: Concreate Bench - Dangerous Hazard, 11th August
item.description:
Stock image. I walked into one of these in oxford street, damaging my leg and causing my leg to bleed in two places. My point is that they are grey , the same colour as the pavement , if they HAVE TO BE THERE, then they sould be a bright colour to drag ones attention towards them. I am on blood thinners, and if I had gone into it with any real force I could have blaead to death. You widen the pavements and then randomly pepper the middle of the pavement witha camoflaged (because its the same colour as the paving stones, where one lease expects a hazard to be , Even if I had not walked into it, its IDIOTIC design. Please remove them all OR paint them bright YELLOW (to signify - DANGER/HAZARD).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 388-396, Oxford Street, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing Dog Waste Bins, 11th August
item.description:
There are two bins in The Glen which runs between Kingswood Avenue and South Hill Road, Shortlands, BR2. Both of these have not been emptied for some time and are overflowing. Please can this be attended to asap, thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): South Hill Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Shopping trolley full of black bags and bags of rubbish left near public bin., 11th August
item.description:
This issue appears time and time again. Can you please remove a shopping trolley full of black bags and two bags of rubbish left next to the yellow bin outside Christchurch in Victoria Road. Many thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Victoria Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Recycling has not been collected from outside my property for 4 weeks, 11th August
item.description:
The recycling or food waste bins not been collected from outside my house for weeks - now poses a health hazard as people are throwing their rubbish on top. Emails to the recycling team have been sent - assurances that this will be sorted but it remains.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Roadsign facing wrong way., 11th August
item.description:
This sign is not facing oncoming traffic. It's warning of a crossing by the park that has a hidden entrance. Cars continually speed down this road and the misplaced sign needs to be moved around. Speed limits need to be put in place too.

item.description:

item.title: Dangerous Area For Children, 11th August
item.description:
Sadly, what was once a lovely idea and nice area which I believe was intended for children, misuse by adults has now made the area dangerous. The log seats, have been broken and moved around to form a drinking area and smoking area. The bolts that originally held the logs together have now been exposed and pose a risk to children cutting themselves or worse. It needs to be made safe before someone is seriously hurt. It was such a lovely feature when first done and is loved by my grandchildren but we can’t risk them using it, even with our supervision. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chervil Mews, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
